tit.e: Japanese Envoys to Tamna (Korean kingdom which ruled Jeju Island in ancient times)

sen.j: 遣耽羅使（けんたんらし）とは、日本（倭国）が耽羅に派遣した使節である。
sen.e: Japanese Envoys to Tamna was dispatched to Tamna from Japan (Wakoku).
Japanese Envoys to Tamna was dispatched to Tamna from Japan (Wakoku).
Japanese Envoys to Tamna was dispatched to Tamna from Japan (Wakoku).

sen.j: 耽羅の歴史的な記録としては3世紀の中国の史書『三国志 (歴史書)』魏志東夷伝に見える州胡が初見であるが、『高麗史』地理志には倭との関係を伝える伝説も記載されており、古くから日本と交流があったらしいことが推察される。
sen.e: The first appearance of Tamna in historical records is as Juho (present Jeju Island) in Weizhi Dongyi zhuan (Records of Wei Concerning Eastern Barbarians) in "Sangokushi (Three Kingdom Saga)", a Chinese history book written in the third century, but the Geographical Record of the "History of Goryeo" also records a legend which reports its relationship with Wa (Japan) suggesting its interaction with Japan from the ancient times.

sen.cmt: 「魏志東夷伝」→訳文では"Weizhi Dongyi zhuan"とあり、出典は下記だと思われますが、「三国志」がローマ字表記なので、こちらだけ現地語発音表記なのは変な気もします。間違いではないと思いますのでそのままにしてあります。（http://www.seaa-web.org/bulletin2008/bul-essay-08-02.htm）"Three Kingdom Saga"→"Three Kingdoms Saga"

sen.j: その後5世紀から6世紀にかけて、『三国史記』の記事に見えるように耽羅は百済に朝貢、服属したと見られている。
sen.e: Tamna seems to have paid tributes and have been subjected to Baekje from fifth to sixth century as written in Samguk Sagi (History of the Three Kingdoms).
Tamna seems to have paid tributes to Baekje and have become its subject from the fifth to sixth century as written in Samguk Sagi (History of the Three Kingdoms).
sen.cmt: 「朝貢して服属した」を簡潔に修正しました。"fifth"の前に"the"を挿入しました。
sen.e: Tamna seems to have paid tributes to Baekje and have become its subject from the fifth to sixth century as written in Samguk Sagi (History of the Three Kingdoms).

sen.j: 660年に百済が唐軍の侵攻によって滅亡すると、耽羅は独自の外交を展開し、同年には唐へ使いを派遣した（『唐会要』）。
sen.e: Upon the fall of Baekje in 660 due to the invasion by the Tang army, Tamna developed its own diplomacy starting with the dispatch of an envoy to Tang in the same year ("唐会要"), and it sent Prince Kumaki to Japan in 661, taking the advantage of the event that the fourth Japanese envoys to Tang drifted down to Tamna, and began to pay tributes to Japan, and, since then, its envoys visited Japan at least nine times by 678 as far as we can see in the official records and it continued to pay tributes to Japanese Imperial court until it was subjected to Silla in 679.

sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処、分けた方が分かりやすいと思います。『唐会要』→"Tang Huiyao" (Institutional History of Tang) (http://history.cultural-china.com/en/174History8742.html)
sen.e: Upon the fall of Baekje in 660 due to the invasion by the Tang army, Tamna developed its own diplomacy starting with the dispatch of an envoy to Tang in the same year ("Tang Huiyao" [Institutional History of Tang]).

sen.j: また661年（斉明天皇7年）には第4回遣唐使が耽羅に漂着したことを期に王子阿波伎等を日本に派遣し入貢し、以後耽羅からは678年（天武天皇7年）までの間に公式記録に残るだけで計9次の使節が日本を訪れ、679年（日本天武天皇8年、新羅文武王元年）に新羅に服属するまで朝貢を続けた。
sen.e: It also sent Prince Awagi to Japan in 661, taking advantage of the event that the fourth Japanese envoys to Tang drifted down to Tamna, and began to pay tributes to Japan; since then, as far as we can see in the official records, its envoys visited Japan at least nine times until 678, continuing to pay tributes to Japanese Imperial court until it was subjected to Silla in 679.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「阿波伎」→「あわぎ」。「あはぎ」という文献もありますが、「は」は音としては「わ」だと思われますので、「あわぎ」としました。（http://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%E2%80%9D%E9%98%BF%E6%B3%A2%E4%BC%8E%E2%80%9D%E3%80%80&hl=ja&tbo=1&tbs=bks:1&ei=_lKETPzcEYfcvQPGhYDFCg&start=0&sa=N）
sen.e: It also sent Prince Awagi to Japan in 661, taking advantage of the event that the fourth Japanese envoys to Tang drifted down to Tamna, and began to pay tributes to Japan; since then, as far as we can see in the official records, its envoys visited Japan at least nine times until 678, continuing to pay tributes to Japanese Imperial court until it was subjected to Silla in 679.

sen.j: また白村江の戦いの降伏者を示した記録に「耽羅国使」が確認できることからこの時期の耽羅は日本とともに百済救援の行動を起こしていたと見られている。
sen.e: Tamna is thought to have worked with Japan to back Baekje at the time because 'Japanese Envoys to Tamna' are included in the list of capitulants of Battle of Hakusukinoe.
Tamna is thought to have worked with Japan to back Baekje at the time because 'Japanese Envoys to Tamna' are included in the list of capitulants of Battle of Hakusukinoe.
Tamna is thought to have worked with Japan to back Baekje at the time because 'Japanese Envoys to Tamna' are included in the list of capitulants of Battle of Hakusukinoe.

sen.j: 日本への入貢に対し、679年（天武天皇8年）と684年（天武天皇13年）には日本から耽羅への使者が派遣されている。
sen.e: Japan responded to the tribute from Tamna by dispatching envoys to Tamna in 679 and 684.
Japan responded to the tribute from Tamna by dispatching envoys to Tamna in 679 and 684.
Japan responded to the tribute from Tamna by dispatching envoys to Tamna in 679 and 684.

sen.j: 初回の使者は不明であるが、684年（天武天皇13年）の使者については、大使犬養手繦、小使川原加尼と『日本書紀』に記録されている。
sen.e: Although the members of the first envoy are not identified, 大使犬養手繦 and 小使川原加尼 participated in the envoy of 684 according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)
sen.cmt: 大使犬養手繦と小使川原加尼の定訳不明
sen.e: Although the members of the first envoy are not identified, the envoy of 684 included senior envoy INUKAI no Tasuki and junior envoy KAWARA no Kane, according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 犬養手繦→「いぬかいのたすき」川原加尼→「かわらのかね」新・国史大年表参照（http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=OWQxAQAAIAAJ&q=%E5%B7%9D%E5%8E%9F%E5%8A%A0%E5%B0%BC&dq=%E5%B7%9D%E5%8E%9F%E5%8A%A0%E5%B0%BC&hl=ja&ei=61uETIX4E4KuvgPSoqDIBA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDQQ6AEwAg）
sen.e: Although the members of the first envoy are not identified, the envoy of 684 included senior envoy INUKAI no Tasuki and junior envoy KAWARA no Kane, according to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 両者とも新羅への遣使の副次として送られたもので、前者は耽羅の新羅への臣属を黙認するもの、後者は報徳国の新羅への併合を受けての動向探索のためと推察されている。
sen.e: Both envoys were dispatched as an addition to envoys to Silla; the first one was dispatched to give silent approval for the Tamna's subjection to Silla and the latter one was dispatched to conduct a research on the trend after the annexation of 報徳国 to Silla.

Both envoys were dispatched as an addition to envoys to Silla; the first one was dispatched to give silent approval for the Tamna's subjection to Silla and the latter one was dispatched to investigate the situation there after the annexation of Hotoku (報徳国) to Silla.
sen.cmt: 「報徳国」→日本語では「ほうとくこく」と読むようです。ローマ字表記し、漢字を併記しました。「動向探索」は現地の状況を確認すること意味なので、"trend"より"situation"を使った方が分かりやすいと思います。
sen.e: Both envoys were dispatched as an addition to envoys to Silla; the first one was dispatched to give silent approval for the Tamna's subjection to Silla and the latter one was dispatched to investigate the situation there after the annexation of Hotoku (報徳国) to Silla.

sen.j: 更に688年（持統天皇2年）と693年（持統天皇7年）にも耽羅からの使者が来日しているが、既に正規の国交を維持する状況になかったためか、入京できずに大宰府で留められている。
sen.e: In addition, envoys from Tamna arrived in Japan in 688 and 693 but they were not allowed to enter the capital and were forced to stay in Dazai-fu, probably because the two countries no longer had a formal diplomatic relations by the time.
